inputs.remark:
V1不包括QuickSIN，QuickSIN属于V2
缺少V2(hearing aid fitting)和V3(2 week follow up)

logic_summary: Removed QuickSIN from V1 as it was administered at the fitting visit (V2) according to the text.
Added V2 (Hearing Aid Fitting) on 2017-03-24 (date from Fig 41.3 timestamp). Included REM, Unaided QuickSIN (moved from V1), and Unaided Self-Assessment.
Added V3 (2-week follow-up) approx. 2017-04-07. Included Aided QuickSIN and Aided Self-Assessment showing improvement.

history.present_illness: Patient returned for hearing aid fitting.
history.prior_management: Hearing aids ordered at previous visit.

tests.name: Real-Ear Measurements (REM)
tests.key_findings: Hearing aids verified to NAL-NL1 targets. Slight adjustments made for comfort and sound quality.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.key_findings: QuickSIN testing reveals a severe signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) loss unaided.

tests.name: Washington University Hearing Aid Self-Assessment Scale
tests.key_findings: Hearing difficulty present in most situations (marked as 'Sometimes').

treatments.name: Hearing Aid Fitting
treatments.details: Bilateral open-fit receiver-in-the-canal (RIC) hearing aids with open domes. Made-for-iPhone. Programmed to NAL-NL1.

history.present_illness: 2-week follow-up. Patient reports doing well and is satisfied. Significantly better in noise.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.key_findings: Significant improvement noted with hearing aids.

tests.name: Washington University Hearing Aid Self-Assessment Scale
tests.key_findings: Improvement in all categories (marked as 'Rarely' or 'Never' for difficulty).

value.outcome: Patient satisfied with hearing aids. No further intervention warranted.
